node.title: Falls Festival ends Tasmanian event after 17 years
node.alt: The mainstage showered in confetti at the 2019/20 leg of Falls Festival in Marion Bay, Tasmania
node.description: After not going ahead last year due to COVID-19, Falls Festival organisers officially scrapÂ Tasmania's annual New Year's music event, confirming it will not return to Marion Bay.
node.content: ["Falls Festival organisers have scrapped Tasmania's annual New Year's music event after 17 years.", "Last year's festival in Marion Bay, in Tasmania's south, was cancelled as a result of COVID-19, but the organisers had hoped the event would return eventually.", "They have now confirmed that will not happen.", "The Victorian version of the event will go ahead, but it will be relocated to Pennyroyal Plains in Murroon \u2014 about 30 minutes from its usual venue in Lorne.", "Festival promoters Jessica Ducrou and Paul Piticco said in a statement it had been a \"privilege\" to operate the festival \"in such beautiful locations\".", "\"We're so thankful to the Surf Coast Shire, Sorell Council and supporting stakeholders of Lorne and Marion Bay who have shown Falls Festival such incredible support over the years,\" the statement said.", "The first Tasmanian Falls Festival was held in 2003.\u00a0", "Since then, the event has attracted international headline acts, including The Hives, Groove Armada, Childish Gambino, Halsey and Franz Ferdinand."]
